title: Economic Emergency Decree Faces Legal Challenges Amidst Gubernatorial Opposition
subtitle: Report automatically generated on 2026-01-17 by the Trade Section, EU Delegation to Colombia
summary: A significant political and economic debate is unfolding as governors from at least 17 departments are challenging the legal viability of President Gustavo Petro's economic emergency decree [[REF:3085fec1-e1cc-4a5e-a328-388424b9582f]]. This "rebellion" stems from concerns that the decree negatively affects departmental finances [[REF:f70d8c9b-5d59-4d4d-98ce-76e02ae513cc]] and potentially impacts territorial autonomy [[REF:3085fec1-e1cc-4a5e-a328-388424b9582f]]. The Constitutional Court's potential intervention and governors' defiance are creating uncertainty around the collection of funds for the economic emergency [[REF:8c4442a2-443c-4954-b4dc-455b70dd2c18]].
key_findings: Governors challenge the legal basis of the economic emergency decree, citing financial and autonomy concerns [[REF:3085fec1-e1cc-4a5e-a328-388424b9582f]].
Constitutional Court's potential ruling and gubernatorial dissent jeopardize economic emergency fund collection [[REF:8c4442a2-443c-4954-b4dc-455b70dd2c18]].
New minimum wage and fuel prices update freight transport cost variables [[REF:6d39915d-4082-4820-a078-5e00434f37e1]].
Small businesses face pressure from minimum wage hikes and increased costs [[REF:f8255cae-62af-4a1c-b331-81660086b681]].

sections.title: Economic Emergency Decree Faces Legal and Political Opposition
sections.body: President Gustavo Petro's economic emergency decree is facing significant opposition and legal challenges from various regional authorities [[REF:3085fec1-e1cc-4a5e-a328-388424b9582f]]. Governors from at least 17 departments have raised concerns about the decree's legal viability, questioning whether territorial authorities can disregard a norm with the force of law [[REF:3085fec1-e1cc-4a5e-a328-388424b9582f]]. Governors such as Rafaela Cortés of Meta have explicitly stated that the decree "affects the finances of the departments" [[REF:f70d8c9b-5d59-4d4d-98ce-76e02ae513cc]], contributing to a broader "rebellion" against the government's economic measures [[REF:2e4b24c7-99dc-418c-8f49-12f0d64964a5]]. The potential intervention of the Constitutional Court, coupled with the defiance of several governors, has placed the collection of funds related to the economic emergency in a state of suspense [[REF:8c4442a2-443c-4954-b4dc-455b70dd2c18]]. This situation highlights a tension between central government authority and departmental autonomy [[REF:3085fec1-e1cc-4a5e-a328-388424b9582f]].

subsections.title: Gubernatorial Concerns Over Decree's Financial and Legal Implications
subsections.body: Governors have voiced strong opinions regarding the economic emergency decree. Rafaela Cortés, governor of Meta, articulated concerns that the decree negatively impacts departmental finances, contributing to the widespread "rebellion" [[REF:f70d8c9b-5d59-4d4d-98ce-76e02ae513cc]]. Similarly, Andrés Julián Rendón, governor of Antioquia, has spoken out about this "rebellion" against the government's decree [[REF:2e4b24c7-99dc-418c-8f49-12f0d64964a5]]. The debate centers on whether subnational entities can legally disregard a norm issued with the force of law, raising questions about territorial autonomy [[REF:3085fec1-e1cc-4a5e-a328-388424b9582f]]. The defiance from at least 17 departments underscores a significant political challenge to the executive's economic policy [[REF:3085fec1-e1cc-4a5e-a328-388424b9582f]].

sections.title: Economic Outlook and Business Climate
sections.body: The Colombian economy is projected to face significant challenges in 2026, with concerns ranging from insufficient economic growth to a worrying fiscal deficit [[REF:bff5dcc0-7681-41aa-964b-58e5e959c7fa]]. AmCham Colombia has emphasized the "urgent need for coherent and responsible economic policy" [[REF:bff5dcc0-7681-41aa-964b-58e5e959c7fa]]. The fiscal panorama is described as being "on the red line," with projections of a 7.1% GDP deficit for 2025, which increases the cost of debt and reduces the margin for social investment [[REF:bff5dcc0-7681-41aa-964b-58e5e959c7fa]]. Furthermore, a decline in tax revenue and increased informality could lead to a larger deficit and necessitate difficult adjustments, such as spending cuts or tax hikes [[REF:bff5dcc0-7681-41aa-964b-58e5e959c7fa]]. Foreign direct investment (IED) remains stagnant, showing $9.16 billion in September 2025 compared to $9.6 billion in the previous period [[REF:bff5dcc0-7681-41aa-964b-58e5e959c7fa]].

subsections.title: Pressures on Small Businesses
subsections.body: Small businesses are experiencing considerable pressure at the beginning of the year. This is largely attributed to a significant 23% increase in the minimum wage, rising surcharges, and a reduction in working hours [[REF:f8255cae-62af-4a1c-b331-81660086b681]]. This confluence of factors is impacting operational costs and profitability for these enterprises [[REF:f8255cae-62af-4a1c-b331-81660086b681]]. A legal challenge has been filed against the decree that formalized this 23% minimum wage increase, arguing that the government did not adhere to established legal criteria for wage adjustments [[REF:81747f0c-160a-424c-9754-6aea833ae5a4]].

subsections.title: Updates in Freight Transport Costs
subsections.body: The Ministry of Transport is actively updating the System of Information on Efficient Costs for Freight Transport (SICE-TAC) by incorporating new economic variables that directly influence the sector's operations [[REF:6d39915d-4082-4820-a078-5e00434f37e1]]. As of this weekend, the system reflects the new minimum wage and current fuel prices. In the coming weeks, tolls and fixed costs will also be integrated as part of a technical process scheduled for January [[REF:6d39915d-4082-4820-a078-5e00434f37e1]]. This update aims to provide a more accurate reflection of operational costs for freight transport [[REF:6d39915d-4082-4820-a078-5e00434f37e1]].

subsections.title: Financial System Performance
subsections.body: The financial system reported an 8% increase in profits through November 2025, reaching $122 trillion compared to $112.9 trillion in the same period of the previous year [[B987219E-560D-4F29-A0C0-77BCED3AB71AC]]. Credit Institutions (EC) led with profits of $14.4 trillion, followed by insurers with $3.6 trillion, and Special Official Institutions (IOE) with $3.2 trillion [[B987219E-560D-4F29-A0C0-77BCED3AB71AC]].

sections.title: Political Developments and Governance Issues
sections.body: Former President Álvaro Uribe has criticized President Gustavo Petro's upcoming meeting with Donald Trump, labeling Petro and Cepeda as allies of Maduro [[A747A95D-A6CB-4480-96E4-EC5017394923]]. Meanwhile, the Colombian Prosecutor's Office has initiated an investigation into a multi-million dollar contract awarded by the Presidency to a law firm representing President Gustavo Petro in the United States [[6512240E-99DC-418C-8F49-12F0D64964A5]]. The contract, amounting to 10 billion pesos (approximately $2.7 million), was signed on January 9 by the Administrative Department of the Presidency (Dapre) with Amadeus Consultancy Limited for legal advisory services [[6512240E-99DC-418C-8F49-12F0D64964A5]]. The Senate President, Lidio García, has expressed concern that proposed budget cuts for Congress could jeopardize its operational capacity and ability to function [[97FFDAA5-676D-4166-B2FA-7AC00F5FD58B]]. The principle of opportunity for Day Vásquez, the key witness against Nicolás Petro, has been extended for an additional year [[AEC48865-6B7B-4986-BB69-889AB933DC32]].

subsections.title: Government Contracts and Investigations
subsections.body: A significant legal advisory contract worth 10 billion pesos ($2.7 million) awarded by the Colombian Presidency to Amadeus Consultancy Limited has triggered an investigation by the Prosecutor's Office [[6512240E-99DC-418C-8F49-12F0D64964A5]]. The firm is reportedly representing President Gustavo Petro in the United States, particularly following his inclusion on the "Clinton List" [[6512240E-99DC-418C-8F49-12F0D64964A5]]. The investigation aims to determine any potential disciplinary responsibility related to this contract [[6512240E-99DC-418C-8F49-12F0D64964A5]]. Separately, President Petro's authority to alter criteria for setting the minimum wage is being questioned through a new lawsuit challenging a decree that increased it by 23% for 2026 [[81747F0C-160A-424C-9754-6AEA833AE5A4]]. The lawsuit contends that legal criteria outlined in Law 278 of 1996 were not followed [[81747F0C-160A-424C-9754-6AEA833AE5A4]].

subsections.title: Congressional Budget Concerns
subsections.body: The President of the Senate, Lidio García, has voiced strong objections to proposed budget cuts for the Congress of the Republic [[97FFDAA5-676D-4166-B2FA-7AC00F5FD58B]]. García warned that such reductions could jeopardize the functioning of the legislative body, stating, "We cannot allow the functioning of Congress to be put at risk" [[97FFDAA5-676D-4166-B2FA-7AC00F5FD58B]]. He emphasized that an adequate budget is crucial for Congress to fulfill its legislative and political oversight duties, adding that a financially weakened Congress cannot adequately respond to citizen demands [[97FFDAA5-676D-4166-B2FA-7AC00F5FD58B]]. García urged a reconsideration of these measures to preserve the parliament's autonomy and operational capacity [[97FFDAA5-676D-4166-B2FA-7AC00F5FD58B]].

sections.title: Technological Threats and Business Adaptation
sections.body: The combination of artificial intelligence (AI) and disinformation presents a significant and evolving threat to companies in Colombia heading into 2026 [[C315DC81-7D18-4F2D-80B1-7E6B79BFA220]]. The Allianz Commercial Risk Barometer 2026 highlights AI as the top risk for Colombian businesses, cited by 48% of respondents, surpassing traditional cyber attacks [[C315DC81-7D18-4F2D-80B1-7E6B79BFA220]]. This phenomenon poses risks beyond economic impacts, potentially distorting markets and damaging corporate reputations [[C315DC81-7D18-4F2D-80B1-7E6B79BFA220]]. In the aviation sector, aeronautical authorities have issued a cautionary notice due to potential disruptions to Global Navigation Satellite Systems (GNSS) over the Pacific Ocean, stemming from military activities [[FA40E246-2EC9-4AAB-B7AF-516295696A02]]. The FAA warned of potential risks to aircraft during all flight phases in specific areas within the Bogotá Flight Information Region (FIR) [[FA40E246-2EC9-4AAB-B7AF-516295696A02]].

sections.title: Sectoral and Regional Updates
sections.body: The Superintendency of Companies has placed the professional football club Deportivo Pereira under administrative control due to critical legal, accounting, and administrative issues, aiming to safeguard the club's stability [[D2E7EF79-10DC-4FBC-901B-6E0F924B8C81]]. In the Catatumbo region, a year-long conflict between the ELN and Farc dissidents for territorial control has resulted in a severe humanitarian crisis, marked by casualties and displacement, according to a UN official [[5160F773-E285-45C5-B558-0276AB0EA8BA]]. This prolonged "drama" continues despite increased military presence [[5160F773-E285-45C5-B558-0276AB0EA8BA]]. The construction guild has raised concerns about legal and access risks associated with a decree aimed at de-indexing affordable housing (Vivienda de Interés Social - VIS), warning that it introduces artificial price controls that disregard current legal frameworks [[F47223CD-BEF3-4A50-9BCE-0FC2D42781ED]]. Marcela Meléndez has been appointed as the new director of Fedesarrollo [[0CAFFAE39-4277-4A15-B72C-1C66B9B51CC5]].

subsections.title: Regional Conflicts and Housing Policy
subsections.body: The conflict in the Catatumbo region, now in its second year, continues to be a major concern, with ongoing clashes between ELN and Farc dissidents [[5160F773-E285-45C5-B558-0276AB0EA8BA]]. A UN official described the situation as a "prolonged drama," highlighting significant casualties and over 100,000 displaced persons [[5160F773-E285-45C5-B558-0276AB0EA8BA]]. Meanwhile, the construction sector is warning of potential legal and access issues arising from a decree intended to de-index affordable housing (VIS) [[F47223CD-BEF3-4A50-9BCE-0FC2D42781ED]]. The guild argues that this measure imposes artificial price controls and contravenes existing legal structures [[F47223CD-BEF3-4A50-9BCE-0FC2D42781ED]].
